TopicTitle: If you think space stations in KSP are hard, try building one out of match sticks.

Articles.Content:
So, in the little county in Iowa that I live in, we have a bit of an eccentric. He builds things out of match sticks. Here's one of his latest creations, the ISS... including the space shuttle.

![pat%20w%20iss%20fb.jpg](http://www.matchstickmarvels.com/images/pat%20w%20iss%20fb.jpg)

![pat%20w%20atlantis%20sized.jpg](http://www.matchstickmarvels.com/images/pat%20w%20atlantis%20sized.jpg)

His other creations can be found here: [http://www.matchstickmarvels.com/](http://www.matchstickmarvels.com/) Be sure to check out the steam punk steam engine he has in the works.

Just thot it might give some of you guys some ideas on what to do with 282,000 pocket I beams... and 8 gallons of glue.

Love it!

Now put a W engine in there and see what happens. (Not really.)
Yep. A Fantastic model. It was on display at Johnson Space Center (or more precisely Space Center Houston) last time I was down in Clear Lake. Very impressive work he does.

> 
> Yep. A Fantastic model. It was on display at Johnson Space Center (or more precisely Space Center Houston) last time I was down in Clear Lake. Very impressive work he does.

He apparently sold it to Ripley's Believe it or Not and they loaned it to the Houston Space Center.

> 
> He apparently sold it to Ripley's Believe it or Not and they loaned it to the Houston Space Center.

Makes sense, considering the rest of the exhibit was 100% Ripley's. Believe it or not. It was a strange exhibit for SSH, aside from the matchsticks.
Artist: (n) One who creates art.  *see also:* Eccentric
